Description: Glazed composition shabti of Padi(khon)s (?) born of Kedja (?) with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard, crossed hands in relief holding an adze and a hoe, the front of the leg-section is inscribed with a panel of incised hieroglyphs; there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Curator's comments: Sir Hans Sloane’s ‘Miscellanea’ catalogue is a bound volume in Central Archives containing seven separate catalogues: ‘Miscellanies’, ‘Antiquities’, ‘Seals’, ‘Pictures’, ‘Mathematical Instruments’, ‘Agate Handles’ and ‘Agate Cups, Bottles, Spoons’. Each contains numbered entries that list and describe objects collected by Sloane between the 1680s and 1750s. Each catalogue begins with object number one. Text from Sloane Miscellanea catalogue: Miscellanea Antiquities 276 "276. The same."; the same referring to Miscellanea Antiquities 273 "273. A very large Ægyptian idol in blew clay Figlina idola varieæ magnitudinis reperta in mummiarum ventre consuta. Jo: Nard. In Lucret." and to "274. The same wt. Hieroglyphicks Isis vid no. 679" and to "275. The same smaller." No. 679 was a shabti from Gualtieri's collection that Sloane catalogued later.
